value: Image detection interface, which can assist you in identifying political, pornographic, advertising, and violent terrorism risks in images; at the same time, it can be combined with your business scenarios to recognize faces, logos, animals, plants, and other content.
Batch detection interface, capable of returning recognition results.

Communication Protocol: HTTP or HTTPS protocol
Request Method: POST method
Character Encoding: utf-8
Parameter Format: All request parameters and return parameters are in JSON format.

Image Types: URL, BASE64.
Image Formats: jpg, jpeg, png, webp, gif, tiff, tif, heif, heic, avif, apng, svg (static image detection is currently supported for svg).
Image Resolution: Currently supports images with resolutions ranging from `20px*20px` to `6000px*6000px`, and it is recommended that the image pixels are not smaller than `256px*256px`.
Image Size: Synchronous interface is limited to 10M, and asynchronous interface is limited to 30M.
Frame Extraction: Long images are not divided by default. If you need to enable the division function, please contact Shumei. After division, the number of reviews and billing may increase. Animated images such as gif are divided into frames based on the input parameters.
Image Address: It is recommended to download images from a CDN source, and the source should not be a single point, otherwise there may be a failure in image download, leading to an inability to review.

Recommended timeout settings: For synchronous batch request interfaces, it is advised to set 20 seconds; for asynchronous batch request interfaces, it is advised to set 5 seconds.

Internal detection logic: The response time of the image detection interface depends on the download time of the image. Please ensure that the storage service where the image to be detected is located is stable and reliable. The connection timeout when ShuMei downloads an image is 2 seconds, and the read timeout is 3 seconds (if it fails, it will be retried once). Batch image services are processed in parallel in two parts internally, with an average processing time of about 500 milliseconds, which is related to the request type and image size.

value.supportProduct:
Chinese image
English image
Arabic image

Chinese image
English image
Arabic image

value.param_description: Company Key. Used for permission authentication, provided by Shumei when activating services.
Event identifier. It is necessary to agree on the values with Shumei.
Application identifier. This field is strictly validated and requires prior agreement with Shumei on the value.

Risk types that need to be identified. At least one of type or businessType should be passed, with the following optional values:

POLITY: Political identification
EROTIC: Erotic & sexy violation identification
VIOLENT: Violent & prohibited identification
QRCODE: QR code identification
ADVERT: Advertisement identification
IMGTEXTRISK: Image text violation identification (if you need to identify violations in the text within the image, be sure to pass the image text violation identification function)
BOCR: OCR support for small languages and automatic language detection (only available in the Singapore cluster)

If multiple functions need to be identified, connect them with an underscore, such as POLITY_QRCODE_ADVERT for a combination of political, QR code, and advertisement identification.
Business types that need to be identified. Either `businessType` or `type` must be passed, with optional values seen in the business label types.

son.param_description: User account identifier. It is recommended to input the user ID, which can be used for risk identification in dimensions such as spamming, advertising, etc.
The array of images to be detected, with a requirement that the array length is within 12.
Unique Client-Side Request Identifier
For images to be detected, you can use the base64 encoding of the image or the URL link of the image.

Base images for comparison detection. The `businessType` field in the request parameters should include the label `FACECOMPARE` when present.
You can use base64 encoded image data or a URL link to the image. Supported formats include:
jpg, jpeg, png, webp, gif, tiff, tif, heif
It is recommended that the image resolution is not less than 256*256 pixels, and the maximum image size is 10MB.
Base images currently do not support long images and animated image formats.
Customer-defined Data ID. Can be used for retrieving data in the ShuMei SaaS backend.
Shumei Device Fingerprinting Identifier. Generated by the ShuMei SDK, used for user behavior analysis.

User Gender, suggested values:
male: Male
female: Female
ambiguity: Ambiguous

GIF frame extraction frequency for detection. Default value is 1. Extract one frame for detection every 'interval' images.

When 'interval' multiplied by 'maxFrame' is less than the total number of images contained in the picture, the frame extraction interval will automatically adjust to the total number of images contained in the picture divided by 'maxFrame' to improve overall detection effectiveness.
The client's public IP address. This parameter is used for user behavior analysis based on the IP dimension.

Language type. When the `type` contains `IMGTEXTRISK`, you can specify the corresponding language type for detection (default is Chinese), with the following options:
- zh: Chinese
- en: English
- ar: Arabic

Maximum number of frames for animated images. When capturing frames from GIFs and other animated images, the maximum is 20 frames, with a default of 3 frames. Billing is based on the actual number of frames captured; for example, if the default is to capture 3 frames, then billing is done according to 3 frames.
The token ID of the message recipient consists of a string of digits, letters, underscores, and hyphens, with a length of no more than 64 characters.
Auxiliary parameters, used for information related to auxiliary detection.

Distinguish between accounts under different applications. Whether to distinguish between accounts under different applications, possible values are:
0: Do not distinguish
1: Distinguish
The default value is 0.
When the value is 1, the account systems under different applications are independent, and account-related policy features are individually counted and take effect under different applications.
Live room/game room number, allowing for the development of different strategies for individual rooms.
Customers input transparent fields. ShuMei will not recognize or process these fields internally and will return them to the user along with the results.

value.param_description:
Select the language type for the return label
Available values:
zh: Chinese
en: English
Default is Chinese if not specified

value: The following parameters, except for code, message, and requestId, are all mandatory return parameters when the code returns 1100.

value.param_description:
Here are the translations for the codes:

1100: Success
1901: QPS Limit Exceeded
1902: Invalid Parameters
1903: Service Failure
1911: Image Download Failed
9101: No Permission to Operate

son.param_description: Client-side request unique identifier

1100: Success
1901: QPS limit exceeded
1902: Invalid parameter
1903: Service failure
1911: Image download failed
9101: No permission to operate

Is it the final audit result (if only machine audit is involved, default returns 1)?
0: Not the final result. This indicates that the result is the machine audit result from Shumei Risk Control, and it still needs to go through Shumei's human audit before being returned to your company for further use.
1: Final result. Your company can directly use the returned result for downstream scenarios such as disposal and distribution.

Here are the translations for the codes you provided:

1100: Success
1901: QPS limit exceeded
1902: Invalid parameter
1903: Service failure
1911: Image download failed
9101: No permission to operate
Shumei requests a unique identifier.

1: Human Review

REVIEW: Suspicious, recommended for manual review
REJECT: Violation, recommended to block directly

Auxiliary Information
Number of actual processed segments
The model version number corresponding to the incoming type value.

Ad version number. The composition is in the form of `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

Pornographic version number. The composition is in the form of `X.Y`, where `X` represents the main version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the sub-version number, usually indicating daily routine iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a main version number of `1001001` and a sub-version number of `2`.

Non-compliant text version number. The format is `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

Politically involved version number. The format is `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

QR Code version number. The format is `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

Terrorist version number. The format is `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

2001: Incorrect input data format, not a valid JSON data
2002: Illegal input parameter field (missing required fields, incorrect type, invalid value, etc.)
2003: Image download failed
2004: Image is too large, exceeding 10M
2005: Illegal image format
2006: Invalid risk monitoring type

Disposal and Mapping Results: ShuMei can return the results according to your company's labeling system and identifiers. If a custom labeling system is not configured, this field will not be returned. If you need to enable it, please contact the business manager.
For the batch image asynchronous interface, after the disposal mapping function is enabled, the callback results will change from the previous overall callback to separate callbacks.
When riskLevel is PASS, it indicates normal status.
Level 1 Risk Label. When the number of beauty labels is not mapped to custom labels, or when the riskLevel under disposal is PASS, return normal.
Secondary risk label. When the number of labels does not map to a custom label, or when the riskLevel under disposal is PASS, it returns as empty.
Level 3 Risk Label. Returns empty when the Shumei label is not mapped to a custom label, or when the riskLevel under disposal is PASS.

If your company has its own disposal rules, ShuMei can configure according to your company's disposal logic and return corresponding disposal suggestions; if the rule tags are not mapped, it will return the default disposal suggestions.
